summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Richard Barnett, commanding him to appear before the grand jury on August 16, 2019, to testify and produce documents in connection with an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The accompanying letter requests confidentiality regarding the subpoena's existence.

persons.name: Richard Barnett
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce evidence related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying confidentiality request letter.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal command (subpoena) to Barnett, compelling his testimony and document production before a grand jury.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Richard Barnett is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and provide evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to Richard Barnett as part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Richard Barnett was subpoenaed to testify before a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York in August 2019.

The grand jury investigation concerned alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for prostitution, coercion, and travel with intent to engage in illicit sexual conduct), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Barnett voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman in July 2019.
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court and subject the recipient to civil and criminal penalties.
